name: 3.4 (Pyrite)
body:
**Note: All changes for releases starting with 3.5 and higher are described in [CHANGELOG.md](https://github.com/beworker/magnet/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).**

This release includes changes from all 3.4-beta and 3.4-rc releases.

- Fix SelectorAttributeParser is treating nots as delimiters (#99).
- Fix "factory uses unchecked or unsafe operations" warning message.
- New auto-type detection for types inheriting from Object/Any types (`Instance.type` property can be omitted).
- New `magnetx-app-rx3android` module for use with RxJava3.
- Multiple improvements to error messages and code in compiler.

name: 3.4-rc2
body: - New `magnetx-app-rx3android` module for use with RxJava3

name: 3.4-rc1
body:
* Fix #99: SelectorAttributeParser is treating nots as delimiters.
* Minor optimizations in compiler.

name: Magnetite
body:
* [Scope inspection](https://github.com/beworker/magnet/wiki/Scope-Inspection)
* [Scope limiting](https://github.com/beworker/magnet/issues/90#issuecomment-507348456)
* Injection of `Lazy<*>` types in Kotlin projects

name: 3.2 (Magnetar)
body: Exactly the same as `3.2-rc1`.

name: 3.2-rc1 (Magnetar)
body:
* Supporting default arguments in constructors (#86)
* Clearing wildcard on parameter types of Lazy (fixes #88)

name: 3.2-beta9 (Neodymium)
body: * Support default values in Kotlin constructors #77

name: 3.1 (Neodymium)
body:
* Support for injectable Lazy<T>, Lazy<T?> and Lazy<List<T>> parameters in Kotlin #75
* Better support for generic types in provider functions #80
* Fixing wrong name generated for scope parameter #84

name: 3.1-beta2 (Neodymium)
body: * Fixing wrong name generated for scope parameter  #84

name: 3.1-beta1 (Neodymium)
body:
* Support for injectable `Lazy<T>`, `Lazy<T?>` and `Lazy<List<T>>` parameters in Kotlin #75 
* Better support for generic types in provider functions #80

name: 3.0 (Neodymium)
body:
* Disposable instances and scopes.
* Java API uses `@NotNull` and `@Nullable` annotations.
* Generated code has `@Generated` annotation #67.
* Private constructors are allowed in instances #63.

name: 3.0-rc1 (Neodymium)
body:
* Fix #67 
* Fix #63

name: 3.0-beta1 (Neodymium)
body:
* Scope became lifecycle aware and can be disposed. 
* Dispose-callback methods can be added to instances.
* Java API has `@NotNull` and `@Nullable` annotations.
* Multiple internal improvements in compiler and runtime.

name: 2.8 (Samarium)
body:
New:
* Multitype binding of the same instance in the same scope through different interfaces (see `Instance.types()`).
* Declarative selectors added (see `Instance.selector()`).
* Selector modules `magnetx-selector-android` and `magnetx-selector-features` added.
* `AppExtension` interface finalized, `AppExtension.Delegate` added.
* Leak Canary and RxAndroid extensions added (see `magnetx-app-leakcanary` and `magnex-app-rxandroid` modules).

Improvements:
* Number of methods in generated factories was reduced by introducing default implementations.
* Repository folder layout was reworked (magnet-extensions were added).

name: 2.8-RC10 (Samarium)
body:
New:
* Multitype binding of the same instance in the same scope through different interfaces (see `Instance.types()`).
* Declarative selectors added (see `Instance.selector()`).
* Selector modules `magnetx-selector-android` and `magnetx-selector-features` added.
* `AppExtension` interface finalized, `AppExtension.Delegate` added.
* Leak Canary and RxAndroid extensions added (see `magnetx-app-leakcanary` and `magnex-app-rxandroid` modules).

Improvements:
* Number of methods in generated factories was reduced by introducing default implementations.
* Repository folder layout was reworked (magnet-extensions were added).

name: 2.8-RC6 (Samarium)
body:
New:
* Multitype binding of the same instance in the same scope was added (see `Instance.types()`)
* `ApplicationExtension` was introduced as a part of `magnetx` package. This is the first extension helping to modularize application in a structured way. Usage examples will follow.
* Experimental `Instance.selector()` (used with `magnetx.android.AndroidSelectorFilter`) for enabling selective injection depending on given selection expression.

Improvements:
* Number of methods in generated factories was reduced by introducing default implementation.
* Repository folder layout was reworked (magnet-extensions were added).

name: 2.8-RC2 (Samarium)
body:
New:
* Multitype binding of the same instance in the same scope was added (see `Instance.types()`)
* `ApplicationExtension` was introduced as a part of `magnetx` package. This is the first extension helping to modularize application in a structured way. Usage examples will follow.

Improvements:
* Number of methods in generated factories was reduced by introducing default implementation.
* Repository folder layout was reworked (magnet-extensions were added).

name: 2.5 (Samarium)
body:
* Fix for static methods failing to provide instance of an inner class
* Update kotlin to 1.2.70
* Restructuring sample app

name: 2.4 (Samarium)
body: * fixing issue #52 getMany() occasionally fails with IllegalStateException

name: 2.3 (Samarium)
body: * Improve compatibility with Kotlin generics

name: 2.2 (Samarium)
body: * Allowing wildcards generics when injecting into list (e.g. `List<DataSource<I>> dataSources`)

name: 2.1 (Samarium)
body: * Fixing issue #42

name: 2.0 (Samarium)
body:
* Magnet became dependency injection library.
* 2.0 has new API which is incompatible to 1.0. Some migration effort will be required.

name: 2.0-RC8 (Samarium)
body: * Suppress "unchecked" warnings in generated factories

name: 2.0-RC7 (Samarium)
body: * Incremental build for annotation processor was enabled (Gradle 4.7 or above)

name: 2.0-RC6 (Samarium)
body: * Optimizing instantiation of HashMaps in Magnet index

name: 2.0-RC5 (Samarium)
body:
* Finalizing public API of 2.0 release.
* Moving all internal implementation classes into `magnet.internal` package.

name: 2.0-RC3 (Samarium)
body:
Changes:
* `Scoping.NONE` renamed into `Scoping.UNSCOPED`.
* Fixed error, when instances configured with `scoping = Scoping.TOPMOST` have ignored their dependencies configured with `scoping = Scoping.DIRECT`. More tests were added.

name: 2.0-RC2 (Samarium)
body:
Changes:

* Added Javadoc and KDoc for API 2.0
* Added `@Implementation.disable` field for temporarily disabling processing of the annotation. It can be used instead of commenting out whole annotation at development.
* Updated Kotlin to 1.2.41

name: 1.0.0 (Alnico)
body: First public release.

name: 0.0.6 (Alnico)
body: - Avoid direct usage of the type interface in factories and indexer

name: 0.0.5 (Alnico)
body: Pre-Release 0.0.5

name: 0.0.4 (Alnico)
body: Pre-Release 0.0.4

name: 0.0.2 (Alnico)
body: Pre-Release 0.0.2
